intro: Tithymalus caiogalus, commonly known as the golden tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits known as schizocarps, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
